p: The flower buds of clove, from the family Myrtaceae, have long been used in both medicine and for culinary purposes. The phenylpropanoids of the essential oil, mainly eugenol, are considered to be the main active compounds of the plant and are responsible for several pharmacological activities ( Chaieb etÂ al., 2007). Clove is known as a tonic for the cardiovascular system in TPM and is thought to improve blood supply to both the heart and the brain. Moreover, it is mentioned to be specifically useful in chronic coughs, shortness of breath, and palpitations ( Aghili Khorasani, 1771).
